message.content:
There are several ways to improve your English vocabulary, some of which include:

1. Read regularly: Reading helps you encounter new words in different contexts, which boosts your understanding and retention. Books, articles, newspapers, blogs—anything that interests you—is a good source for learning new words.

2. Keep a vocabulary journal: Whenever you come across unfamiliar terms or phrases when reading or listening to the language, write them down along with their meanings and examples of usage if possible.

3. Learn derivatives and word families: A single root word can give rise to many different forms like nouns, verbs or adjectives (e.g., emotion – emotional – emotionally). Learning these patterns will help expand your vocabulary faster.

4. Use flashcards or mobile apps: There are countless tools available today – ranging from old-school index cards used as flashcards to dedicated smartphone apps like Anki or Quizlet–that allow users to practice and review their newly-acquired words more efficiently.

5. Engage with native speakers: Join online forums, attend language exchange groups in person/virtually via websites such as meetup.com/speaky.com where people share a common interest for language learning is also an effective way.

6. Listen actively during conversations/movies/podcasts/TV shows – paying close attention not only allows you grasp the nuances but also familiarize yourself better with sentence structure/idiomatic expressions etc 

7.Listening materials could be news channels e.g BBC radio world service

8.Learn synonyms/antonyms - this enables grasping varied ways on how convey essentially same idea whilst avoiding repetition ; enriching both oral/written discourse

9.Watch films/documentaries/appearances by native speakers so get acquainted different accents 10.Focus daily basis including weekends
